page.title: 11GULVAL CUSTOMS
page.content:
{Crying the Neck}is an old custom held at Gulval Churchtown each September. All the corn is cut except for a piece left standing for the vicar to bless. People remember that years ago it was thought that the last bit must be left for the spirit of the corn to live until the next year's harvest.
{Gulval Feast}is the Monday nearest to Saint Gudwal's Day in November. It is a school holiday. Village families and friends get together for a special meal. The hunt meets at Churchtown. The Master drinks the stirrup cup, and the hounds and horses move off to hunt a fox.
Although the{Cornish Language}has not been spoken generally for 200 years, a service in Cornish and English is sometimes held at Gulval Church.
